avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant snowmelt or subsidence has occurred. Avalanches can occur in limited areas, and caution should be exercised in terrain traps. Snow is forecasted in mountains on Tuesday until Wednesday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Significant snowmelt or subsidence has occurred. Prior to this, wind slabs were present high in mountains following persistent southwest and north winds. The snow is considered fairly stable, but avalanches can occur in limited areas, and caution should be exercised in terrain traps. Snow is forecasted in mountains on Tuesday until Wednesday.

travelAdvisory.highlights: During warming over the weekend the snowpack across the country was affected, initially making it unstable, but stabilizing during freezing. Weak layers are found in N-, E-, and W- parts.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlæg átt, bætir í vind og úrkomu seinnipart mánudags. Hægbreytileg átt og snjókoma á þriðjudag, hvessir í auslægri átt og bætir í úrkoma aðfaranótt miðvikudags.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small wet sluffs have fallen in Seljalandshlíð, 17/2. Avalanche fell in N-aspect in Súgandafjörður last Monday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Some melting has occurred and the snow has partially subsided. Thaw over the weekend may have broken down weaknesses, and the snow should become more stable. Weaknesses may still be present where the thaw hasn"t fully penetrated or reached the snowpack.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Some melting has occurred and the snow has partially subsided. Thaw over the weekend may have broken down weaknesses, and the snow should become more stable. Prior layered wind slabs were in all aspects and weaknesses were found between layers. Snowprofiles in the area from the 7th, 8th and 10th of February confirmed this and compression tests gave a sudden collapse at 10-40 cm depth. Weaknesses may still be present where the thaw hasn"t fully penetrated or reached the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.highlights: During warming over the weekend the snowpack across the country was affected, initially making it unstable, but stabilizing during freezing. Weak layers are found in N-, E-, and W- parts.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægbreytileg eða austlæg átt og lítilsháttar él en bjart á köflum á þriðjudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: There have been no reports of avalanches in the area since a snowmobiler triggered a thick slab on a south-facing slope in Upsadal on February 10th. Prior to that, avalanches occurred in northerly directions last week in Ólafsfjörður, Svarfaðardalur, and across Ólafsfjarðarvegur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: On Monday, temperatures drop again after the warming over the weekend, which may cause the surface to stiffen, bridging lower layers. A weakness is widespread in the snowpack, between wind slabs and at the interface with older snow. Whumpfing has been observed widely in recent days and snow pits show that the weakness is still present.

snowpackStructure.highlights: On Monday, temperatures drop again after the warming over the weekend, which may cause the surface to stiffen. Weakness may still be present in the snowpack, although it may be more challenging to trigger avalanches on it now that temperatures have cooled again. Faceted crystals have been found near the crust layers, and a high temperature gradient was measured in a snow pit in Skarðdal on February 16th. Tests showed fractures in the snowpack, and whumpfing was heard widely across the forecast area before the weekend, indicating a persistent weakness. A snowmobile triggered an avalanche on the layer on 10.2.

travelAdvisory.highlights: During warming over the weekend the snowpack across the country was affected, initially making it unstable, but stabilizing during freezing. Weak layers are found in N-, E-, and W- parts.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðlægar áttir og að mestu bjart og þurrt á sunnudag. Suðaustan 8-13 og rigning seint á mánudagskvöld og hiti 1 til 7 stig.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche in Skagafell in Fagridalur 18/2. Sowmobile triggered an avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður 14/2. Avalanches in N-aspect in Seyðisfjörður and S-aspect in Eskifjörður and Norðfjörður last Monday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Some melting has occurred and the snow has partially subsided. Thaw over the weekend may have broken down weaknesses, and the snow should become more stable. Weaknesses may still be present where the thaw hasn"t fully penetrated or reached the snowpack.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Some melting has occurred and the snow has partially subsided. Thaw over the weekend may have broken down weaknesses, and the snow should become more stable. Weaknesses were found widely within the snowpack in the area prior to the thaw. A snowprofile in Oddskarð, 14/2, showed a CT2 at a depth of 60 cm, and a slab in Stafsdalur, 16/2, showed a CT4 at a depth of 13 cm. Weaknesses may still be present where the thaw hasn"t fully penetrated or reached the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.highlights: During warming over the weekend the snowpack across the country was affected, initially making it unstable, but stabilizing during freezing. Weak layers are found in N-, E-, and W- parts.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðlægar áttir og að mestu þurrt yfir daginn á mánudag og þriðjudag en rigning/slyddda aðfaranótt þriðjudags. Suðaustan og snjókoma á miðvikudag.
